name: The Hall of the Fomorian
tagline: Looming fir trees, surrounded with a weird, pink luminescence. Jagged, mutant cones litter the ground.

procedural.foraging_results: Successful foraging yields 1d2 Shub Eggs, in addition to the normal results

description: At the very bottom of a steep, fir-wooded dingle, a 30′ high wall looms abruptly into view. Composed of gargantuan marble flagstones smoothed to a mirror-like lustre, it proves to be the side of a 500′ square massive stone platform. A stairwell on each side leads to the top.

points_of_interest.name: The Hall of the Fomorian
points_of_interest.description: A massive stone platform with a domed hall at its center. The platform is 500′ square and 30′ high, with stairwells on each side leading to the top.
points_of_interest.entering: A stairwell on each side leads to the top of the platform. The domed hall has an arched doorway on its eastern face.
points_of_interest.interior: A dry, musty, cavernous space, barely illuminated by reddish light filtered through the glass pyramid above. A mass of broken statuary draped with ancient, mouldering rugs fills much of the room. Atop this heap sits the Scrying Globe, a giant figure—the Fomorian—leaning over it, peering into it with concentration.
points_of_interest.exploring: The Fomorian guards the Scrying Globe and forbids any to approach it, resorting to deadly force should PCs persist. A character need only don an emerald green cloak and announce that they are 'Jack-the-Emerald-Cloaked' to satisfy the Fomorian of Jack's arrival.
points_of_interest.leaving: Characters exiting Buttercup Lane in this hex appear outside the domed hall atop the massive platform.
points_of_interest.inhabitants: The Fomorian, an immortal guardian from the 'World Below'

special_features.name: Massive Platform
special_features.description: Platform top: A bare, cracked expanse, its monotony broken only by small tussocks of grass, occasional flocks of birds, and a structure at its very centre: the Domed Hall.

special_features.name: Domed Hall
special_features.description: A purple-veined half-bubble of stone, 30′ tall and 80′ in diameter. A pyramid of scarlet glass sits at its peak.

special_features.name: The Scrying Globe
special_features.description: A great, glowing orb. Should a character peer into the globe—after satisfying, defeating, or otherwise evading the Fomorian—they perceive the Emerald Door within.

special_features.name: The Emerald Door
special_features.description: Visible within the Scrying Globe is a door of scintillating emerald, surrounded by dense, bluish mist. Touching the globe whisks one away to the fairy road Buttercup Lane.

npcs.name: The Fomorian
npcs.description: A blue-skinned giant standing roughly 15′ tall, wearing a grey wool tunic, bracers of black metal, and a thick belt of cracked brown leather. A grim helm of raw black iron partially covers a beard of pale, finger-thick earthworms that wriggle constantly. The helmet's visor covers a writhing, black smudge in place of eyes.
desires: To be relieved of his vigil by the (imaginary) 'Jack-the-Emerald-Cloaked'
secrets: A guardian placed here by the fairy trickster Lord Gladhand to toy with mortals wishing to enter the Emerald Door
npcs.stat_reference: Large Monstrosity—Sentient—Neutral, Level 16 AC 15 HP 64 Saves D2 R3 H4 B5 S6, Att 2 fists (+11, 2d6) or gaze (glassify) Speed 60, Morale 11 XP 4,250

dm_notes: Ley line Hoad: Arcane spell-casters perceive the feeling of having just awoken from a dream.
